intro: Ruellia formosa, commonly known as the showy ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue, purple, or white. Ruellia formosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
